title: The Invasion
dialogue_disasters: Lethbridge-Stewart: 'I think those crazy kids have gone off to the sewers to get photographs of the Cybermen.'
goofs: In episode five, the panel concealing the Cyber director struggles to close.
The Cyberman falling from the roof of an IE building in episode eight is clearly an empty costume.
Zoe's and Isobel's knickers are frequently revealed.

In episode six, Gregory's sudden low-budget announcement of the off-screen recapture of Professor Watkins by UNIT is followed by his low-budget on-screen death as an extra who looks nothing like him is shot by a Cyberman in the sewer.

continuity_notes.name: TARDIS
continuity_notes.current_status: Rendered invisible due to a faulty visual stabiliser circuit

continuity_notes.name: United Nations Intelligence Taskforce (UNIT)
continuity_notes.description: Military organization dealing with alien threats
continuity_notes.current_status: Newly formed, with headquarters in a Hercules transport plane

technobabble: Gregory states narrow bandwidth transducers should make 'transmission more directional'.
Zoe disables the IE computer, giving it an insoluble Algol equation: 'Real X sum positive, delete square… print out Y to the minus X variable one.'

locations.name: London
locations.current_status: Setting for the story in Spring 1969

untold_adventures: The Doctor and Jamie's encounter with Cybermen on 'Planet 14'
additional_notes: This story was intended to be set in the near future, but there's little to suggest it doesn't take place in the late 1960s. It serves as a pilot for the early 70s Doctor Who format.
bottom_line: A comparatively large budget leads to an all-action romp, showing the advantages of recognisable Earth settings. The sign of things to come.
